intro: Gaylussacia canescens, commonly known as the snowberry bush, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant ecosystems.
